description: Detects overconfidence in personal or institutional memory. Flags when vivid recollection or repetition is treated as proof of factual accuracy.

linguistic: certainty-from-memory phrases ('I remember it exactly', 'I saw it myself')
dismissal of records or corroboration ('I don‚Äôt care what data says')
appeals to shared nostalgia ('everyone knows it was like that')
behavioral: defensiveness when confronted with conflicting evidence
story stabilization over time (details become cleaner, not messier)

fusion_logic.method: inverse weighting between memory_confidence and external_evidence_strength

thresholds.high (>0.6): memory frailty ‚Äì recall treated as infallible fact

recommended_reflection_prompt: Cross-check recollection with contemporaneous records or witnesses.
Treat confidence as an emotional signal, not verification.
Invite multiple perspectives before closing conclusion.
